comment: Dr. Kwan is very helpful. He makes study guides that are set up exactly like his test. You have to use ALEKS for this class and be careful because the due dates will sneak up on you. Dr. Kwan even helps you with questions you have during test. He is there to help you earn the A. Take if you are a incoming freshman.

This class was an easy A, but there was a lot of work to do on ALEKS that you have to keep up with. He is a very nice man and the tests are plenty easy. He allows you to redo a test if you're not happy with your first grade. If you are already comfortable with math, class will be boring. He really does teach well.

Professor Kwan is a good decision for multiple reasons to those who are not good at math but try - allows test retakes for in class tests, INSANE amount of office hours (he truly cares if you need the extra help, but many still did not take the opportunity to show up), accepts late work (I wouldnt condone it though), and his lectures try to be fun
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: He's one of the few choices for MATH 111 that actually lectures and teaches, which is why I took him. I am not good at teaching myself. Grade comes from four tests, the final, and HW that is done in ALEKS. He drops the lowest HW grade and allows you to retake one test (and when you do, he makes you fix it until you get it all right, so easy A).

4 test and final, with2 tests in class provided with study guides and allows a FULL PAGE cheat sheet. He allows you to retake the in class ones. Other tests and homework were online on ALEKS and its annoying but its bc of our math department. Gives many chances to make up late quizzes, tests, work. His lectures can be confusing but hes funny.

I went to every class and did mostly just the homework which helped me a ton. Each test there is a study guide which explains exactly what is on the exam, also he gives study sessions before each exam.

His test are difficult, but he gives you a chance to make it up. Homework isn't really that hard either. The main problem I had in his class was that his lectures are absolutely terrible. His strong accent can be a problem and he constantly messes up examples and creates confusion. It's pretty safe to say he wasn't my professor, rather Youtube was.
Have to do ALEKS almost once a week. He is funny and really cares about what he does, however, tests are H A R D.

Professor Lam is a solid choice for anyone who isn't the best at math. Each quiz is a take home quiz, all homework is online and he posts the answers on d2l, he allows cheat sheets on each test (3) and the final. He lets students retake tests as many times as they want and basically accepts late work until the end of the semester.

Ill admit Im not great at math, like any math at all, but hes super willing to work with you to get the a reasonable grade. I dont know if he does this for every class but for mine he allowed students to retake tests as many times as they wanted. Theres a lot of homework and take home quizzes and they really add up so do all of them!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader
